citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Section
citeinfo.title: MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP: Mile-Marker Reference Post Inventory for Roads in Indiana, 2015 (Indiana Department of Transportation, Point Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Section

citeinfo.othercit:
This data set was provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) by Indiana Department of Transportation, Business Information and Technology Systems, GIS Mapping personnel. The data set provided was in an ESRI shapefile format, and was named "STATEREFPOSTS," and was provided to personnel of the IGS on September 13, 2006.
NOTE -- An update of these data was obtained from INDOT personnel on June 26, 2012 (as an ESRI point feature class named "DOTGIS_Ref_Post_Exor"). Another update of these data containing mile-markers for the extension of Interstate 69 (I-69) was obtained from INDOT personnel on November 8, 2012 (as an ESRI point feature class named "I_69_RP").
NOTE -- An update of these data was obtained from INDOT personnel on July 1, 2016 (as an Esri point feature class named "MILE_MARKERS").

descript.abstract: MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP is a point shapefile that contains locations of all mile-marker Reference Post point Inventory for roads in Indiana, in a geospatial point format. The data were derived from pre-existing INDOT basemaps and databases. Data were provided by personnel of Indiana GIS Department of Transportation (INDOT), Road Inventory. The source data provided by INDOT was an ESRI point feature class (in a file geodataase) named "MILE_MARKERS." MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP is attributed with route numbers, and mile-marker post numbers. On November 8, 2012 mile-markers for the extension of Interstate 69 (I-69) were added to these data. Each Reference Post point Inventory is placed as to Position, Measure, and by Reference Post Name. The posts are "names" for known spots on the road. The names are sequentially numbered along the road. The Reference Post point Inventory is Dated as of 2006-2015.
descript.purpose:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by INDOT for the source data class named "MILE_MARKERS":
"Designed to display points, at one mile increments along state routes to be used in displaying projects, assets and other datasets in an accurate geographic position."

cntorgp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Transportation, Road Inventory Supervisor (Eric Rader)

idinfo.native: Esri point feature class in file geodatabase (10.3) format, approximately 825 Kb

attracc.attraccr: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
dataqual.complete: This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be complete.

horizpa.horizpar: None reported. This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.

vertacc.vertaccr: None reported. This data set was provided by INDOT personnel and is assumed to be accurate.

srcinfo.srccontr: Mile-marker Reference Post point Inventory for roads in Indiana

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile named STATEREFPOST from INDOT personnel on September 13, 2006. STATEREFPOST was loaded into ESRI ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. The following attribute columns were deleted from the associated attribute table: OBJECTID, ID, LRS_ID, and CO_LOG. IGS personnel then saved the shapefile as MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN. It should also be noted that portions of the associated metadata provided by INDOT for STATEREFPOST were extracted and included in this metadata file.

IGS personnel received an ESRI file geodatabase containing a point feature class named "DOTGIS_Ref_Post_Exor" from INDOT personnel on June 26, 2012. DOTGIS_Ref_Post_Exor point feature class was loaded into ESRI ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then exported the feature class to an ESRI shapefile format named as "MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP".

IGS personnel received an ESRI point shapefile named "I_69_RP.SHP" from INDOT personnel on November 8, 2012. I_69_RP.SHP was loaded into ESRI ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then used the Merge command in ESRI ArcToolBox to combine the previous version of MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP and I_69_RP.SHP into a temporary shapefile named MILE_MARKERS_INDOT_UPDATE_NOV2012.SHP. The temporary shapefile was then renamed MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP.

IGS personnel received an Esri file geodatabase containing a point feature class named "MILE_MARKERS" from INDOT personnel on July 1, 2016. It was loaded into Esri ArcMap and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. IGS personnel then exported the data to an Esri point shapefile and renamed MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: INDOT internal Identification Number for the mile-marker
Text description of the type of System 1 road, the interstate/route number, and also the mile-marker number

Mile-marker post description (includes three components describing road description, road route number, and mile-marker value. Road descriptions are "I" for Interstate, "S" for State Route/Road, "T" for Toll Road, and "U" for U.S. Highway.)

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Department of Transportation be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [MILE_MARKERS_SYSTEM1_INDOT_IN.SHP: Mile-Marker Reference Post Inventory for Roads in Indiana, 2015 (Indiana Department of Transportation, Point Shapefile), 20161025].
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

The Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) Provides these geographic data "as is" and the user accepts the data "as is", and assumes all risks associated with its use. By acceptance of this data, the user agrees not to transmit this data or provide access to it, or any part of it, to another party unless the user shall include with the data a copy of this disclaimer. INDOT makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. INDOT further makes no warranties, either expressed or implied as to any other matter whatsoever, including, without limitation, the condition of any product, or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of INDOT, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by INDOT regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
In no event shall INDOT have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by INDOT."

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
